Goodwill is tested for impairment on an annual basis and whenever there is an indication that
the recoverable amount of a cash generating unit (CGUs) is less
than its carrying amount. For the impairment test, goodwill is allocated to the CGU or groups of CGUs which benefit from the synergies of the acquisition and
which represent the lowest level at which goodwill is monitored for internal management purposes.

The recoverable amount of CGUs is determined based on higher of value-in-use and fair value less cost
to sell. Key assumptions in the cash flow projections
